ab.title: Exodus 27
ab.l: And you shall makean altar of acacia wood. Five cubits long,and five cubits broad, the altar shall be foursquare,and the height of it shall be three cubits.
And you shall makethe horns of it on its four corners.Its horns shall be one with it. And you shall overlay it with bronze.
And you shall make its cauldrons to remove its ashes,and its brushes and its cups and forksand its censers. You shall make all its equipment of bronze.
And you shall make for it a grate, a network of bronze,and on the net you shall make four bronze ringson its four corners.
Andyou shall put it under the ledge of the altar beneathso that the net may be halfway up the altar.
And you shall make poles of acacia wood for the altar andoverlay them with bronze.
And the poles shall be putinto the rings, and the poles shall beon both sides of the altar when it is carried.
You shall make it of hollow boards as you were shownin the mountain. They shall do it so.
And you shall make the courtof the tabernacle: for the south side, southward,curtains for the court of twined linen of a hundred cubits longfor one side,
And its twenty pillars and its twenty basesof bronze, their hooks and their bandsof silver.
And so for the north side:in length, curtains of a hundred cubits long and itstwenty pillars and their twenty bases of bronze, the hooksof the pillars and their bands of silver.
And the breadth of the court on the west side:curtains of fifty cubits, their pillars ten and their basesten.
And the breadth of the court on the east side,eastward, fifty cubits.
And curtains of fifteencubits for one side, their pillars three, and their basesthree.
And on the second side:curtains of fifteen cubits, their pillars three and their bases three.
And for the gate of the court: a cover of twenty cubits,of blue and purple and scarlet silk and twinedlinen of embroiderer’s work, their pillars four and theirbases four.
All the pillars all around the court:banded with silver, their hooks of silverand their bases of bronze.
The length of the court:a hundred cubits, and the breadth of it fifty cubits, fifty cubits,and the height five cubits of twined linen, and their basesof bronze.
All the equipment of the tabernacle for allits service, and all its pegs, and all the pegs of thecourt: of bronze.Parashat Tetzaveh
And you shall command the childrenof Israel that they shall bring youpure beaten olive oil for the light, to kindle the lamp continually.

In the tent of meeting, outside the veil whichis above the Law, Aaron and his sons shall arrangeit from evening until morning before the Lord. It shall be a statute foreverthroughout their generations from the children of Israel.
